item.title: 诺福克南方公司同意执行脱轨调查建议
item.description: 诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）周三表示，该公司已同意执行美国国家运输安全委员会在 2023 年 2 月俄亥俄州东巴勒斯坦发生列车脱轨并泄漏有毒化学品事故后提出的一系列安全建议、【原文：Norfolk Southern said on Wednesday it had agreed to implement a series of safety recommendations made by the National Transportation Safety Board following a February 2023 train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio that spilled toxic chemicals,】

item.title: 据《竞技体育》报道，NBA 与 ESPN、NBC、亚马逊敲定电视转播协议
item.description: 据《The Athletic》周三援引消息人士的话报道，美国国家篮球协会已敲定一项协议，康卡斯特旗下的 NBC 和亚马逊公司旗下的 Amazon Prime Video 将成为新的合作伙伴，而迪士尼旗下的 ESPN 将继续作为 NBA 总决赛的主场。【原文：The National Basketball Association has finalized a deal that will make Comcast's NBC and Amazon.com's Amazon Prime Video new partners, while maintaining Disney's ESPN as the home of the NBA finals, the Athletic reported on Wednesday, citing sources.】

item.title: 美国检察官称，被流放的中国商人从追随者那里偷走了数百万美元
item.description: 一名美国检察官周三表示，一名流亡的中国商人将从网上粉丝那里筹集的数亿美元用于虚假投资，购买了包括一辆红色兰博基尼和一艘游艇在内的奢侈品。【原文：An exiled Chinese businessman spent hundreds of millions of dollars he raised from online followers for sham investments on luxury goods including a red Lamborghini and a yacht, a U.S. prosecutor said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 暂缓收购 HubSpot
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 放弃了收购在线营销软件公司 HubSpot 的计划。【原文：Google-parent Alphabet has abandoned its plans to buy online marketing software company HubSpot , Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 马斯克的 Neuralink 公司正在开发新的大脑植入设备
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的大脑芯片公司 Neuralink 正在研发一种新设备，该公司的高管表示，他们认为这种设备只需在大脑中植入一半数量的电极，就能使其更高效、更强大。【原文：Neuralink, Elon Musk's brain-chip company, is working on a new device that it believes will require half the number of electrodes to be implanted in the brain to make it more efficient and powerful, the company's executives said.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美国联邦贸易委员会将就胰岛素价格起诉药品中间商
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，美国联邦贸易委员会正计划起诉 UnitedHealth、Cigna 和 CVS Health 这三家最大的药房福利管理公司，指控它们在包括胰岛素在内的药品价格谈判中采取的策略。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is planning to sue UnitedHealth , Cigna and CVS Health - the three largest pharmacy-benefit managers - over their tactics for negotiating prices for drugs including insulin, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欺诈案庭审结束，检察官称 Ozy Media 创始人参与了 "大规模欺诈行为
item.description: 在前有线电视新闻主播欺诈案的结案陈词中，联邦检察官周三告诉陪审员，Ozy Media 的联合创始人卡洛斯-沃森（Carlos Watson）向投资者谎报了这家已倒闭初创公司的收入，以掩盖其严重的债务问题。【原文：Ozy Media co-founder Carlos Watson lied to investors about the defunct startup's revenue to hide its crippling debt, a federal prosecutor told jurors on Wednesday during closing arguments in the former cable news anchor's fraud trial.】

item.title: 美联储主席鲍威尔无论大选如何，都将在 "必要时 "采取行动
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周三表示，央行将在 "需要的时候 "做出利率决定，不会考虑即将到来的总统大选。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday said the central bank would make decisions on interest rates "when and as they need to be made" with no consideration to the coming presidential election.】

item.title: 波音公司首席执行官在 MAX 探针违规后致电 NTSB 主席道歉
item.description: 波音公司首席执行官戴夫-卡尔霍恩（Dave Calhoun）周三表示，在美国国家运输安全委员会称波音公司提供了有关 737 MAX 中空面板爆炸的非公开信息后，该安全委员会的最高官员向波音公司道歉，并发誓波音公司将遵守政府规定。【原文：Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun apologized and vowed the planemaker would follow government rules after the National Transportation Safety Board said the company provided non-public information about the 737 MAX mid-air panel blowout, the safety panel's top official said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 新兴市场投资组合连续第 8 个月流入，亚洲居首 -IIF
item.description: 周三的一份报告显示，6月份新兴市场投资组合连续第八个月吸引外资流入，其中流入除中国以外的亚洲市场的资金占绝大部分，但美国的高利率正在影响资金流入的规模和前景。【原文：Emerging market portfolios attracted foreign inflows for an eighth consecutive month in June with flows to Asia ex-China taking the lion's share, but the high U.S. interest rates are affecting the scale and the outlook of flows, a report showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克击败被解雇的推特员工提出的 5 亿美元遣散费诉讼
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）拒绝向数千名 Twitter 员工支付至少 5 亿美元的遣散费。【原文：Elon Musk won dismissal of a lawsuit claiming he refused to pay at least $500 million of severance to thousands of Twitter employees he fired in mass layoffs after buying the social media company now known as X.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称资产负债表缩减仍有一段路要走
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔周三在众议院金融服务委员会表示，美联储在缩减资产负债表规模方面还有 "相当长的路要走"，量化紧缩政策的终点仍不确定。【原文：The Federal Reserve has "quite a ways to go" in trimming the size of its balance sheet with the endpoint of quantitative tightening still uncertain, Fed Chair Jerome Powell told the House Financial Services Committee on Wednesday.】

item.title: 捷蓝航空要求美国机构取消联合航空赢得华盛顿特区新航班的资格
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）周三要求美国交通部取消美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）从拥挤的华盛顿里根国家机场（Washington Reagan National Airport）获得五个新往返航班中的一个航班的资格。【原文：JetBlue Airways asked the U.S. Transportation Department on Wednesday to disqualify United Airlines from winning one of five new roundtrip flights from congested Washington Reagan National Airport.】

item.title: 付款问题阻碍俄罗斯进口中国汽车
item.description: 俄罗斯汽车经销商协会负责人告诉路透社记者，由美国制裁引起的中俄两国之间的支付问题给俄罗斯进口中国汽车带来了严重问题，这些汽车在过去两年中一直供应俄罗斯国内市场。【原文：Payment issues between Russia and China, caused by U.S. sanctions, pose serious issues for Russian imports of Chinese cars that have supplied the domestic market over the last two years, the head of Russia's car dealers' association told Reuters.】

item.title: 由于对中国产电动汽车征收关税，特斯拉在欧洲提高了 Model 3 的价格
item.description: 由于欧盟委员会对中国制造的电动汽车征收关税，特斯拉在德国、荷兰和西班牙等欧洲国家提高了Model 3汽车的价格，根据车型的不同提高了约1500欧元（1622美元）。【原文：Tesla raised the prices of its Model 3 cars in European countries including Germany, the Netherlands and Spain by about 1,500 euros ($1,622) depending on the variant of the model due to the European Commission's tariffs on China-made EVs.】

item.title: 阿根廷 6 月通胀加速，结束连续五个月通胀趋势
item.description: 据路透社周三的一项民意调查显示，阿根廷 6 月份的通胀率预计将加速上升至 5%以上，这将结束连续五个月物价上涨放缓的局面。【原文：Argentina inflation is expected to have accelerated to over 5% in June, which would end a five-month streak of slowing price increases, according to a Reuters poll on Wednesday.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚广播公司新闻总裁将卸任，派拉蒙着眼于在合并中削减成本
item.description: 根据路透社看到的内部备忘录，哥伦比亚广播公司新闻总裁英格丽德-西普里安-马修斯（Ingrid Ciprian-Matthews）将在媒体巨头派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）的调整中卸任，派拉蒙全球公司将与 Skydance Media 合并。【原文：CBS News President Ingrid Ciprian-Matthews will step down from her role amid a shakeup at media giant Paramount Global, which is set to merge with Skydance Media, according to internal memos seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 法官驳回第一公民对汇丰挖走硅谷银行员工的指控
item.description: 第一公民银行股份有限公司（First Citizens BancShares）起诉汇丰银行在硅谷银行高调倒闭后挖走该行 40 多名员工，加州一名联邦法官驳回了该公司的大部分诉讼请求。【原文：A federal judge in California has dismissed most of First Citizens BancShares' $1 billion lawsuit accusing HSBC of poaching more than 40 employees of Silicon Valley Bank after its high-profile collapse.】

item.title: 停电阻碍了飓风贝里尔的恢复，延误了港口和基础设施的重启
item.description: 飓风贝里尔登陆两天后的周三上午，得克萨斯州仍有约 170 万用户停电，因为夜间进展缓慢，阻碍了恢复关键石油基础设施的工作。【原文：About 1.7 million customers remained without power in Texas on Wednesday morning, two days after Hurricane Beryl made landfall, as progress was slow during the night, hampering efforts to restore critical oil infrastructure.】

item.title: 独家报道微软与 CISPE 达成反垄断申诉和解协议
item.description: 美国科技巨头微软和该行业组织周三表示，微软已就CISPE对其云计算许可行为的反垄断投诉达成和解协议。【原文：Microsoft has clinched a deal to settle CISPE's antitrust complaint about its cloud computing licensing practices, the U.S. tech giant and the trade group said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）将在重大改革中裁员 100 人，专注于数字领域
item.description: 根据路透社周三看到的一份内部备忘录，新闻媒体 CNN 将裁员约 100 人，作为整合新闻业务和加强数字业务计划的一部分。【原文：News outlet CNN will cut about 100 jobs as part of a plan to consolidate news operations and bolster its digital business, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国汽车安全机构称更换不合格安全气囊气体发生器致三人死亡
item.description: 美国汽车安全监管机构周三表示，低成本的故障替代安全气囊气体发生器已造成三人死亡，两人重伤。【原文：U.S. auto safety regulators said Wednesday three people have been killed and two seriously injured by low-cost faulty replacement air bag inflators.】

item.title: 沃尔玛将通过五个新仓库加快易腐物品的配送速度
item.description: 沃尔玛（Walmart）周三表示，将在美国新建五个高科技仓库，旨在加强和加快向其 4,600 家门店配送易腐产品的速度。【原文：Walmart on Wednesday said it will build five new warehouses with a high tech spin in the United States aiming to bolster and speed up the distribution of perishable products to its 4,600 stores.】

item.title: 谈判失败后，沃尔玛智利工人工会发起罢工
item.description: 沃尔玛智利工会在一份声明中说，在新的集体谈判协议谈判失败几天后，该工会于周三发起了罢工。【原文：Walmart Chile's workers union launched a strike on Wednesday, days after negotiations for a new collective bargaining agreement failed, the union said in a statement.】

item.title: 美国 5 月批发库存增加
item.description: 美国批发库存在 5 月份稳健增长，这可能使库存投资有望支持第二季度的经济增长。【原文：U.S. wholesale inventories increased solidly in May, likely putting inventory investment on track to support economic growth in the second quarter.】

item.title: 阿根廷推出航空改革，希望引进外国航空公司
item.description: 阿根廷政府周三公布了一项旨在开放该国航空业的全面法令，邀请外国航空公司进入长期由国营航空公司阿根廷航空公司（Aerolineas Argentinas）主导的市场。【原文：The Argentine government published a sweeping decree on Wednesday aimed at opening up the country's aviation sector, inviting foreign airlines to enter the market long dominated by state-run carrier Aerolineas Argentinas.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利看好特斯拉的能源存储部门
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）上调了对特斯拉储能业务的估值，预计人工智能热潮将推动全球电力需求激增，该公司有能力扩大其在该领域的市场份额。【原文：Morgan Stanley raised its valuation for Tesla's energy storage business, expecting a global surge in demand for power driven by the artificial-intelligence boom, and the company's ability to grow its market share in the segment.】

item.title: 美国和墨西哥采取行动挫败中国规避美国钢铝关税的行为
item.description: 美国和墨西哥周三宣布采取新措施，打击中国和其他通过墨西哥运输产品的国家规避美国钢铝关税的行为，实施北美钢材 "熔化和浇铸 "标准。【原文：The U.S. and Mexico on Wednesday announced new steps to fight the circumvention of U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum by China and other countries that ship products through Mexico, implementing a North American "melted and poured" standard for steel.】

item.title: 研究显示：通胀挤压预算，美国 Z 世代消费者依赖父母
item.description: 美国银行周三发布的一份报告显示，由于通货膨胀和生活成本上升，美国 Z 世代成年人面临着越来越大的财务挑战，其中 46% 的人依赖父母和家人的经济援助。【原文：Gen Z adults in the U.S. face increasing financial challenges because of inflation and rising living costs, with 46% relying on financial assistance from their parents and families, according to a report by Bank of America published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 三星在可折叠手机中加强人工智能，在智能手表和戒指中加强健康监测
item.description: 三星电子周三发布了最新款可折叠智能手机，使其最昂贵的旗舰机型变得更轻、更薄，并增强了人工智能功能，以挑战苹果在高端市场的主导地位。【原文：Samsung Electronics unveiled its latest foldable smartphones on Wednesday, making its priciest flagship model lighter and slimmer and bolstering AI functions as it challenges Apple's dominance in the premium market.】
